contentrichtext.text: {{chembox | Watchedfields = changed | verifiedrevid = 430036884 | ImageFile = Xanthydrol.svg | ImageSize = 200px | ImageAlt = Skeletal formula | ImageFile1 = Xanthydrol-3D-balls.png | ImageSize1 = 200 | ImageAlt1 = Ball-and-stick model | IUPACName = 9''H''-xanthen-9-ol | OtherNames = Xanthanol, 9-Hydroxyxanthene, 9-Xanthydrol, Xanthen-9-ol, 9-Xanthenol, Xanthydrol solution | Section1 = {{Chembox Identifiers | Abbreviations = | CASNo = 90-46-0 | CASNo_Ref = {{cascite|correct|??}} | EINECS = 201-996-1 | PubChem = 72861 | ChemSpiderID_Ref = {{chemspidercite|correct|chemspider}} | ChemSpiderID = 65693 | StdInChIKey_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChIKey = JFRMYMMIJXLMBB-UHFFFAOYSA-N | StdInChI_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChI=1S/C13H10O2/c14-13-9-5-1-3-7-11(9)15-12-8-4-2-6-10(12)13/h1-8,13-14H | Beilstein = 10395 | SMILES = O2C1=C(C=CC=C1)C(C3=C2C=CC=C3)O | RTECS = | MeSHName = | ChEBI_Ref = {{ebicite|correct|EBI}} | ChEBI = | KEGG_Ref = {{keggcite|correct|kegg}} | KEGG = | ATCCode_prefix = | ATCCode_suffix = | ATC_Supplemental =}} | Section2 = {{Chembox Properties | Formula = |C=13|H=10|O=2| | MolarMass = <!-- calc --> | Appearance = | Density = | MeltingPt = 124−126 °C | Melting_notes = Goldberg<ref>{{cite journal | author = Goldberg; Wragg | year = 1957 | journal = Journal of the Chemical Society | pages = 4823–4829 | doi = 10.1039/JR9570004823 | title = 972. Spasmolytics derived from xanthen }} </ref> | BoilingPt = | Boiling_notes = | Solubility = | SolubleOther = | Solvent = | pKa = | pKb = }} | Section7 = {{Chembox Hazards | EUClass = | EUIndex = | MainHazards = | NFPA-H = | NFPA-F = | NFPA-R = | NFPA-O = | RPhrases = {{R42}} {{R43}} | SPhrases = {{S22}} {{S36}} {{S37}} {{S45}} | RSPhrases = | FlashPt = | Autoignition = | ExploLimits = | PEL = }} }} '''Xanthydrol''' is an organic chemical compound. Its formula is [[Carbon|C]]<sub>13</sub>[[Hydrogen|H]]<sub>10</sub>[[Oxygen|O]]<sub>2</sub>. Its total molecular weight is 198.221 [[Gram|g]]/[[Mole (unit)|mol]]. Xanthydrol is used to test the levels of [[urea]] in the bloodstream. ==Synthesis== Xanthydrol can be produced by the [[organic redox reaction|reduction]] of [[xanthone]]. ==See also== *[[Xanthene]] *[[Xanthone]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Alcohols]] [[Category:Xanthenes]] {{alcohol-stub}}
